issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
http://docs.appcelerator.com/titanium/latest/#!/api/Titanium.UI.TableViewRow-property-className

Docs state className is not used on iOS. Can you confirm/expand on this? The code for TiUITableViewRowProxy would suggest otherwise, but my objc isn't strong enough to be certain.

thanks
fields.summary: className not used in iOS on TableViewRow?

comments.body:
Hello Mitchell,

Questions about the implementation of classes are better suited for the community boards:

http://developer.appcelerator.com/questions/newest

JIRA is an environment to post potential bugs or issues with the platform or SDK. If you have a particular test case which shows a disparity between what is represented in the docs and what you are seeing in run-time then please provide such information. 

Regards,
Carter

Hi Carter, 

That why I opened it as a docs question - because the docs dont seem to reflect the Ti code.

[~meeech] className property is available on iOS platform but it is ignored. This behavior is also documented here.

http://docs.appcelerator.com/titanium/latest/#!/api/Titanium.UI.TableViewRow-property-className
"This property exists on iOS, Tizen and Mobile Web, but is ignored."
